item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Gansey had once told Adam that he was afraid most people didn't know how to handle Ronan. What he meant by this was that he was worried that one day someone would fall on Ronan and cut themselves." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Is this thing safe?" "Safe as life," Gansey replied." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "He strode over to the ruined church. This, Blue had discovered, was how Gansey got places - striding. Walking was for ordinary people." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "How do you know I wouldn't have just been happy with the truth? I don’t care if my father was a deadbeat named Butternut. It doesn't change anything right now.” “His name wasn't really Butternut, was it?” Gansey asked Adam in a low voice." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description:
"We have to be back in three hours," Ronan said. "I just fed Chainsaw but she'll need it again."
"This," Gansey replied "is precisely why I didn't want to have a baby with you." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Blue tried not to look at Gansey's boat shoes; she felt better about him as a person if she pretended he wasn't wearing them." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Blue. My name's Blue Sargent.' 'Blair?' 'Blue.' 'Blaize?' Blue sighed. 'Jane" -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Is that all?" she whispered. Gansey closed his eyes. "That's all there is." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "As always, there was an all-American war hero look to him, coded in his tousled brown hair, his summer-narrowed hazel eyes, the straight nose that ancient Anglo-Saxons had graciously passed on to him. Everything about him suggested valor and power and a firm handshake." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Ronan didn't need physics. He could intimidate even a piece of plywood into doing what he wanted." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: River add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "The inside of the old Camaro smelled like asphalt and desire, gasoline and dreams." -- Maggie Stiefvater
